title: Change assertion to prevent IoTDBInterpreterTest from failing due to indeterminate ordering
body:
Some tests in the class `org.apache.zeppelin.iotdb.IoTDBInterpreterTest` can fail based on the order of iteration in `ConcurrentHashMap`. These tests are `testShowTimeseries`, `testShowDevices`, `testShowDevicesWithSg`, `testShowAllTTL`, and `testShowStorageGroup`.

I found the issue using [NonDex](https://github.com/TestingResearchIllinois/NonDex):
```
mvn test-compile -pl tsfile -am
mvn -pl zeppelin-interpreter edu.illinois:nondex-maven-plugin:1.1.2:nondex -Dtest=org.apache.zeppelin.iotdb.IoTDBInterpreterTest
```
The test can fail because it assumes that the order of the data is determinate, and can be fixed it by ignoring the order.

title: Fix the issue that FragmentInstance's status cannot be set to FINISHED
body:
## Description
In some scenario, the FragmentInstance's status is always `FLUSHING`, although the corresponding query is finished. It is because there is a corner case in SinkHandle which lead to the `onFinish()` method cannot be invoked.

The corner case is:
There are two conditions to be satisfied that the FragmentInstance's status will be set to FINISHED:
1. The `noMoreTsBlocks` is true
2. The cached TsBlocks has been sent.

And these two conditions will be checked every time the `acknowledge event` is received in SinkHandle; the `noMoreTsBlocks` will be set to true when the `close()` is invoked.

Before this change, if the last `acknowledge event` is received but the `close()` is still not invoked, we will lost the chance to set the FragmentInstance's status to FINISHED. 

## Changes
Fix the issue by adding finished status check every time the `noMoreTsBlocks` is invoked.

title: Fix schema file with cache of size 1
body:
## Description
Before this pull request, schema file stores all pages in a map, and only flushes dirty pages if the cache had no more space for new pages. 
With the cache map of size 1, a dirty page may be evicted from the cache during a method which modifies multi pages (like creating a new multi-page segment) and this makes a exception unexpected.

### What's new in this PR
Now, schema file uses an extra map called dirtyPages to collect all pages modified during write or delete method within the file instance, and flushes will occur before the method ends.

title: [IOTDB-2984] RatisConsensus Recovery Logic
body:
## Description
Remove RaftGroupMap and RaftClientMap, which are unable to auto recovery during restart.

title: [IOTDB-2930]Fix concurrent UnPin bug & Improve template implementation
body:
## Description


### Fix concurrent UnPin bug
After a thread unPin a node, it should check the cache status of the node. If the node is now not Pinned, then its parent should be unPin once, which means one of the children is not pinned any more. However, the operation and check should be synchronized, otherwise the change may result in multi threads get wrong cache status and do extra unpin, which may result in negative semaphore value.

### Improve template implementation
The old implementation of template check during insert takes low performance and is hard to understand. Thus the implementation is rewritten.

title: Filter non schemaRegionDir
body:
## Description


### Cause
In Mac os, there are hidden dirs or files, named with ```.DS_Store``` suffix. When recover schemaEngine and such dirs or files is scanned, NumberFormatException will be thrown.

### Solution
When encountering NumberFormatException, ignore this and skip this dir, since a schemaRegion dir is named after a numeric number.

[IOTDB-2979] Optimize the serialization and deserialization of thrift data structures
body:
In ThriftCommonsSerDeUtils and ThriftConfigNodeSerDeUtils the serialization and deserialization of various data structure interface is implemented by artificial. This is not conducive to the follow-up extension to upgrade.

So in this PR, I use thrift's read/write interface to serialize/deserialize thrift defined data structures.

2. Fix an issue that the coordinator cannot cleanup QueryExecution if the QueryExecution throws exception when constructing, which will lead to client stuck.

body:

The reason for this exception is that, the validation check for selected sequence files does not check the existence of the files. So in the end of IT, though the file is clear, the deleted files will be chosen.

title: [IOTDB-2950]Fix concurrent bug of CachedMNodeContainer.putIfAbsent
body:
## Description


### One of the causes
The ```CachedMNodeContainer.putIfAbsent``` is not thread-safe, which may results in subTree loss or unexpected replacement when creating timeseries concurrently.

### Solution
Rewrite ```CachedMNodeContainer.putIfAbsent``` and make it synchronized.

title: Fix the bug when matching pattern tree using multi-wildcard
body:
## Description

When matching `**.xx` with a `node`, we need to push two times. 
 1. One push for `xx` and `node.children()`; 
 2. the other push for `**.xx` and `node.children()`.

Before this change, if the `xx` cannot match `node.children`, the second push is lost. This PR fix this scenario.

title: Add ColumnMerger to merge multipul input columns of same sensor into one column
body:
1. Add `ColumnMerger` to merge multipul input columns of same sensor into one column. Currently, I only implement `SingleColumnMerger`.
2. Fix `TimeJoinOperator` bug that if we query one non-exist sensor, we will get NPE. Add UT for this corner case.

title: [IOTDB-2880] Fix import check style
body: Fix import check style

title: Add block cancel when GetBlockTask throws exception
body:
## Motivation
A scenario will lead to the invoker wait permanently when using SourceHandle. That is, the SourceHandle's EOS has been received while the GetDataBlockTask is still in progress. And then, the GetDataBlockTask throws exception. If the invoker is waiting the `blocked` future it will be blocked permanently here.

## Solution
Cancel the `blocked` if the GetDataBlockTask threw exception

title: [IOTDB-2945] Reconstruct ConfigNode manage layer and persistence layer
body:
Currently, ConfigNode manages Region allocation information and StorageGroupSchema in RegionInfoPersistence. But ConfigNode must prepare to storage cluster schema, and the StorageGroupSchema belongs to the cluster schema. So this refactoring normalized the ConfigNode's manage layer and persistence layer.

Changes:

- Rename and move ConfigNode inner classes
- Remove RegionInfoPersistence
- Add ClusterSchemaManager
- Add StorageGroupInfo
- Merge RegionInfoPersistence and PartitionInfoPersistence
- Split RegionManager into PartitionManager and ClusterSchemaManager

See [ConfigNode 架构](https://y8dp9fjm8f.feishu.cn/docs/doccnUzGLXivqOoNjAo8Ole3cQe) for more details.

title: [IOTDB-2968] RatisConsensus snapshot implementation
body:
## Description
In This PR, I implemented the Ratis snapshot mechanism.

The application can refer to `IntegerCounter` in `RatisConsensusTest.java` to see how to implement the snapshot interface in IStateMachine.

Notice, currently in Ratis 2.2.0 there is a bug in installSnapshot which can cause the subsequent snapshot from leader failed to install without explicitly warning. This bug is fixed in Ratis Master, and we can expect this bug fix be included in Ratis 2.3.0.

title: Add FragmentInstanceStateMachine for FragmentInstance State change
body:
1. Let SinkHandle notify FragmentInstanceStateMachine to change to FAILED state while meeting errors in async send event.
2. Rename `Driver` to `IDriver` and add another new `Driver` abstract class, extract duplicated code from `DataDriver` and `SchemaDriver` to their parent class `Driver`.
3. Add FragmentInstanceStateMachine to manage FragmentInstance State change
4. Add Inner Exclusive Lock called `DriverLock` in `Driver` to prevent it from closing by others while it is still running.

body:

How to deal with Aggregation functions like AVG, FIRST_VALUE, LAST_VALUE with TsBlock?
When aggregating parital result, they both need multi columns, like AVG needs COUNT and SUM columns, FIRST_VALUE needs TIMESTAMP and VALUE columns,

title: [IOTDB-2845] Implementation of DeviceViewOperator Part1
body:
What DeviceViewOperator need to do is traversing the device child operators, get all tsBlocks of one device and transform it to the form we need, then get the next device operator until no next device.

If some columns are not existing in one device, those columns will be null. e.g.  [s1,s2,s3] is query, but only [s1, s3] exists in device1, then the column of s2 will be filled with NullColumn.

title: [IOTDB-2966]fix CompactionTaskManagerTest CI
body:
**Bug Description**
See details in [IOTDB-2966](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-2966). 
**Reason**
(1) the created unseq file has the same name with the first seq file.
(2) the main test thread occupies the object lock of the CompactTaskManager, causing the compaction sub thread to be blocked.
**Solution**
(1) create different name of unseq file.
(2) use obj.wait() to release lock instead of Thread.sleep().

title: Change the result of ConfigExecution from Void to TsBlock
body:
## Motivation

Some execution which need to be run in ConfigNode will have resultSet such as `show storage group`. We need to make the ConfigExecution has the ability of returning result set after executing.

## Changes
Change the body of `Future` of IConfigTask from `Void` to `ConfigTaskResult`. And `ConfigTaskResult` will contains two params: 1. the status code; 2. the result set if it has.

title: [IOTDB-2965] Skip failed mlog and snapshot items when upgrading happens
body:
After this fix, the `MetadataUpgrader` will not throw any exceptions if recovering one plan from snapshot or mlog.bin failed.

I think it's better to tell DBAs to backup the `system` directory before upgrading to new version.

title: [IOTDB-2932]Fix localPartitionTable concurrent bug
body:
## Description

### Cause
There are three components involved in timeseries creation: storage group, schemaRegionId, and schemaRegion.
The three components are managed respectively by storageGroupSchemaManager, localSchemaPartitionTable and SchemaEngine.
The creation of each component are separated, while the timeseries creation requires all the three components be prepared well atomically.

### Solution
Strengthen the auto create method to cover existence check of all the three component.

### Additional work
Refactor the recover logic of localSchemaParitionTable. The SchemaEngine now is enabled to check the local schema partition info while recovering, and the localSchemaParitionTable will be init based on the info returned by SchemaEngine.

title: [IOTDB-2887][IOTDB-2930][IOTDB-2932] Fix recover test error in CI & Fix NPE while concurrent createTimeseries & Add config check for schema engine mode
body:
## Description

### IOTDB-2887 Fix recover test error in CI
Sometimes schema recover test in CI may fail. 

The cause is that when the ```EnvironmentUtil.restartDameon()``` is invoked, ```LocalConfigNode.clear()``` is invoked and all the schema-related thread pool will be ```shutdownNow```, which means if a thread is waiting something, including the disk I/O, it will be interrupted and shutdown. Therefore, the file, for example, the mlog, may not store all the data in memory and will be different from what we expected.

Thus the ```threadPool.shutdownNow()``` is replaced by ```threadPool.shutdown()```, which guarantees that the thread task will finish and the data will be flushed to disk.

### IOTDB-2930 Add config check for schema engine mode
The schema engine mode should not be changed after initializing IoTDB for the first time, since the storage structures of different modes are not compatible with each other.

### IOTDB-2932 Fix NPE while concurrent createTimeseries
When set storage group, localPartitionTable should init a set for this storage group. The two steps are not grouped as synchronized operation, thus another thread may get the storage group while the partition table is not prepared well.

Thus a existence check and auto create mechanism is added to prevent npe.

see : https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-2954

## Bug Fixes
- Use Jackson instead of Gosn, because Gosn will convert all number type in the object into double type

title: Add Driver.failed() call in FragmentInstanceScheduler
[IOTDB-2942] [IOTDB-2944] Delete duplicate data structure in node-commons and extend TDataNodeLocation
body:
Changes:

1. Build thrift-commons package
2. Extend TDataNodeLocation
3. Delete duplicate data structure in node-commons, including: GroupType, RegionReplicaSet, Endpoint, DataNodeLocation, SeriesPartitionSlot and TimePartitionSlot.

See [公共结构](https://y8dp9fjm8f.feishu.cn/docs/doccnwYEhSIw2a1Qo1F2KXsfLIb) for more details.

title: [IOTDB-2943] Fix cannot use stop-server.sh to stop IoTDB
body:
See [IOTDB-2943](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/IOTDB/issues/IOTDB-2943?filter=allopenissues).
The reason for this bug is that, the `awaitTerminate` function in `CompactionTaskManager` is synchronized, which cause a deadlock with `removeRunningTaskFuture`.

title: Rename thrift endpoint
body:
It is quite confusing when there are 2 classes named "EndPoint". They are org.apache.iotdb.commons.cluster.EndPoint and org.apache.iotdb.common.rpc.thrift.EndPoint.

By convention, the name of thrift generated classes should start with "T", so I renamed the org.apache.iotdb.common.rpc.thrift.EndPoint to org.apache.iotdb.common.rpc.thrift.TEndPoint.

title: Add input location for TimeJoinNode
Separate SchemaRegion Memory Implementation
body:
## Description


### Motivation
It is confusing to mix memory mode and schema file mode in one schemaRegion implementation, and it is hard to maintain schema file mode without affect memory mode.

The implementation of schema file mode already have a little effect on the performance of memory mode, due to try-finally and the Pin/UnPin and memory control mechanism. 

### Modification
Separate SchemaRegionMemoryImpl and SchemaRegionSchemaFileImpl, both implement ISchemaRegion.
Separate MTreeBelowSGMemoryImpl and MTreeBelowSGCachedImpl, both implement IMTreeBelowSG.

title: Remove mpp_mode property in iotdb-engine.properties
body: We don't mpp_mode property because if we start from `DataNode` Class, it must be mpp mode.

title: Optimize dependencies management to reduce the lib size
body:
## Description

In this PR, I change the Junit maven scope to `test` to reduce the distribution package size.

After these change, the distribution package size can be 1MB smaller than before.

title: [IOTDB-2803][new cluster][mpp] refine show plan node ser/deserialize
body:
1. Refine show timeseries/devices plannode's ser/deserialize according to mpp plannode ser/deserialize framework.
2. Delete `ShowNode` `ShowDevicesNode` and `ShowTimeSeriesNode`
3. Change `ShowDeviceNode` to `SeriesScanNode` in plan node ser/deserialize UT tests
4. Add ser/deserialize UT tests for  `TimeSeriesSchemaScanNode` and `DevicesSchemaScanNode`
5. Override `clone` and `equals` in `TimeSeriesSchemaScanNode` and `DevicesSchemaScanNode`

jira: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-2803

title: [IOTDB-2931] Remove access to metadata manager during compaction
body: Currently, in the compaction process, the metadata information of time series needs to be obtained from the MetadataManager. This can be a performance bottleneck in distributed edition in the future. Therefore, this Issue aims to remove the access to the MetadataManager and get the time series metadata information directly from the TsFile.
